title: Book 1 - Beginner Level

words.meaning: a round fruit with red, yellow, or green skin and white flesh
words.example: I eat an apple every day for breakfast.

words.meaning: a set of printed pages that are held together in a cover
words.example: I love reading books in my free time.

words.meaning: a small animal with fur, four legs, and a tail that people keep as a pet
words.example: The cat is sleeping on the sofa.

words.meaning: an animal with four legs and a tail that people keep as a pet
words.example: The dog is playing in the garden.

words.meaning: to put food into your mouth and swallow it
words.example: We eat dinner at 7 PM every evening.

words.meaning: someone you know well and like
words.example: Sarah is my best friend from school.

words.meaning: of high quality or standard
words.example: This is a very good movie.

words.meaning: a building where people live
words.example: They live in a beautiful house near the park.

words.meaning: having great value or significance
words.example: It's important to study hard for exams.

words.meaning: work that you do to earn money
words.example: She has a good job at the hospital.

words.meaning: to have information about something
words.example: I know the answer to that question.

words.meaning: to enjoy something or find it pleasant
words.example: I like chocolate ice cream.

words.meaning: to create or produce something
words.example: She likes to make cakes on weekends.

words.meaning: recently created or bought
words.example: I bought a new car last week.

words.meaning: having lived or existed for a long time
words.example: This is an old building from the 1800s.

words.meaning: human beings in general
words.example: Many people live in this city.

words.meaning: to look at and understand written words
words.example: I read the newspaper every morning.

words.meaning: to use your eyes to look at something
words.example: I can see the mountains from my window.

words.meaning: to use your mind to consider something
words.example: I think this is a good idea.

words.meaning: the indefinite continued progress of existence
words.example: What time is it now?

words.meaning: to have a desire for something
words.example: I want to learn English.

words.meaning: to do a job or activity
words.example: I work in an office.

words.meaning: a period of 365 days
words.example: I started learning English last year.

words.meaning: having lived for only a short time
words.example: She is a young teacher.

words.meaning: free from dirt or impurities
words.example: Keep your room clean and tidy.

description: Essential English vocabulary for beginners with basic words and common phrases.
